segments.source_content: We willÂ **launch Docusaurus 2.0**Â very soon ([2.0-rc.1](https://twitter.com/docusaurus/status/1547616687117070338?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)Â published). I will send you a special edition for the occasion. It will be the occasion to present you better this project I work on since 2+ years with Facebook. Docusaurus 2.0 is not the most famous React framework, but it remainsÂ [**very used**](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1549083893822885888?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)Â despite being in beta: twice as much as Remix or Redwood, and is progressively catching up with Gatsby. I hope I can count on you for theÂ **ProductHunt launch**Â ğŸ˜„.

segments.source_content: This week, I want to highlightÂ [tRPC](https://github.com/trpc/trpc?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)Â to make remote calls (client/server or even server/server). Typical end-to-end solution, agile, and much easier to use than GraphQL. There is no particular event related to the lib, except a significant gain in popularity thanks to Theo and hisÂ [create-t3-app](https://github.com/t3-oss/create-t3-app?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)Â framework.

translations.fr: Cette semaine, je souhaite mettre en avant [tRPC](https://github.com/trpc/trpc?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter) pour effectuer des appels distants (client/serveur ou mÃªme serveur/serveur). Solution typique de bout en bout, agile et bien plus simple Ã  utiliser que GraphQL. Aucun Ã©vÃ©nement particulier liÃ© Ã  la bibliothÃ¨que, sauf un gain significatif de popularitÃ© grÃ¢ce Ã  Theo et son framework [create-t3-app](https://github.com/t3-oss/create-t3-app?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter).

segments.source_content: ## React

translations.en: ## React

segments.source_content: [**Reading Source Code: React**](https://alexkondov.com/readint-source-code-react/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

translations.fr: [**Lire le code source : React**](https://alexkondov.com/readint-source-code-react/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)
translations.en: [**Lire le code source : React**](https://alexkondov.com/readint-source-code-react/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

segments.source_content: Alex reads the React source code and comments on several parts, taking as an entry point the mount of a React application. Interesting details about the use of prototypes, JSX, and the interaction of the (agnostic) reconciler with the DOM renderer.

translations.fr: Alex lit le code source de React et commente plusieurs parties, prenant comme point d'entrÃ©e le montage d'une application React. DÃ©tails intÃ©ressants sur l'utilisation des prototypes, du JSX et de l'interaction du rÃ©conciliateur (agnostique) avec le moteur de rendu DOM.
translations.en: Alex lit le code source de React et commente plusieurs parties, en prenant comme point d'entrÃ©e le montage d'une application React. DÃ©tails intÃ©ressants sur l'utilisation des prototypes, du JSX et l'interaction du rÃ©conciliateur (agnostique) avec le moteur de rendu DOM.

segments.source_content: [**Can We All Just Admit React Hooks Were a Bad Idea?**](https://medium.com/codex/can-we-all-just-admit-react-hooks-were-a-bad-idea-c48120c5188d?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

translations.fr: [**Pouvons-nous tous admettre que les hooks React Ã©taient une mauvaise idÃ©e ?**](https://medium.com/codex/can-we-all-just-admit-react-hooks-were-a-bad-idea-c48120c5188d?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)
translations.en: [**Can We All Just Admit React Hooks Were a Bad Idea?**](https://medium.com/codex/can-we-all-just-admit-react-hooks-were-a-bad-idea-c48120c5188d?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

segments.source_content: Amy argues that React hooks do not respect SOLID architecture principles. I don't really agree, but recognize that most of the examples found on the internet are simplified and don't necessarily highlight a good architecture.

translations.fr: Amy soutient que les hooks React ne respectent pas les principes d'architecture SOLID. Je ne suis pas totalement d'accord, mais reconnais que la plupart des exemples trouvÃ©s sur Internet sont simplifiÃ©s et ne mettent pas nÃ©cessairement en avant une bonne architecture.
translations.en: Amy soutient que les hooks React ne respectent pas les principes d'architecture SOLID. Je ne suis pas vraiment d'accord, mais reconnais que la plupart des exemples trouvÃ©s sur internet sont simplifiÃ©s et ne mettent pas nÃ©cessairement en avant une bonne architecture.

segments.source_content: [**Applying SOLID principles inÂ React**](https://konstantinlebedev.com/solid-in-react/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

translations.fr: [**Appliquer les principes SOLID dans React**](https://konstantinlebedev.com/solid-in-react/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)
translations.en: [**Applying SOLID principles inÂ React**](https://konstantinlebedev.com/solid-in-react/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

segments.source_content: Almost a direct answer to the above article, even if the application of SOLID is more widely covered here (components + hooks). Note: don't hesitate to use the React context for dependency injection.

translations.fr: Presque une rÃ©ponse directe Ã  l'article prÃ©cÃ©dent, mÃªme si l'application de SOLID est plus largement couverte ici (composants + hooks). Note : n'hÃ©sitez pas Ã  utiliser le contexte React pour l'injection de dÃ©pendances.
translations.en: Presque une rÃ©ponse directe Ã  l'article prÃ©cÃ©dent, mÃªme si l'application de SOLID est plus largement couverte ici (composants + hooks). Note : n'hÃ©sitez pas Ã  utiliser le contexte React pour l'injection de dÃ©pendances.

segments.source_content: **Extras:**

translations.fr: **En complÃ©ment :**
translations.en: **Extras:**

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ“œÂ [Avoid anonymous components with displayName](https://julesblom.com/writing/component-displayname?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter): sometimes React can't infer a good name for your components, which complicates the use of devtools (Context, memo, forwardRef, HOC)
- ğŸ“œÂ [Why Remix is not a React framework but a full stack web framework](https://andre-landgraf.dev/blog/2022-07-16_why_remix_is_not_a_react_framework_but_a_full_stack_web_framework/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter): a well-written overview of the differences between Remix and other frameworks. Remix is full-stack and framework-agnostic.
- ğŸ“œÂ [Functional programming is finally going mainstream](https://github.com/readme/featured/functional-programming?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter): GitHub highlights the popularization of functional programming, in part thanks to React, Redux and hooks. I personally switched career from Scala to React after reading David Nolen's famous post. Didn't even like JS before 2014 ğŸ˜…
- ğŸ“œÂ [Why Docusaurus is a powerful documentation framework](https://blog.1password.com/docusaurus-documentation-framework/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter): 1Password explains why Docusaurus is a good solution for their developer documentation portal. Touch various advanced topics, including site customizations, remark plugins to extend MDX/Markdown...
- ğŸ“œÂ [Store data in a cookie with sessions and Remix](https://jonmeyers.io/blog/store-data-in-a-cookie-with-sessions-and-remix?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter): creation of a visit counter cookie
- ğŸ“–Â [Remix Deferred](https://github.com/remix-run/remix/blob/deferred/docs/guides/streaming.md?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter#using-deferred): new API under development that gives fine control over data loading tradeoffs on initial page load. Optimize for Time-to-first-byte or Cumulative Layout Shift.
- ğŸ“–Â [Next.js accessibility doc improvements](https://twitter.com/nextjs/status/1549043787330375680?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)
- ğŸ¦Â [New Preact VDOM state model](https://twitter.com/_developit/status/1549001036802625536?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)
- ğŸ¦Â [Remix + React 18 startTransition + time-sliced hydration](https://twitter.com/ryanflorence/status/1547959632663961602?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter): Ryan Florence sharing a controversial tip. Starts interesting discussions about hydration ([Ryan Carniato](https://twitter.com/RyanCarniato/status/1549100194708353024?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter),Â [Andrew Clark](https://twitter.com/acdlite/status/1549109283387744256?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)...)
- ğŸ“¦Â [pmndrs/react-three-rapier](https://github.com/pmndrs/react-three-rapier?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter): integrates react-three-fiber with Rapier (physics engine)
- ğŸ“¦Â [Remotion 3.1](https://www.remotion.dev/blog/3-1?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter): many new features! Gifs, Tailwind CSS, springs with duration, OffthreadVideo...
- ğŸ“¦Â [Remix 1.6.5](https://github.com/remix-run/remix/releases/tag/remix%401.6.5?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter): loader + useLoaderData TypeScript inferenceğŸ‘Œ
- ğŸ“¦Â [Framer Motion 6.5](https://twitter.com/mattgperry/status/1547581579974696961?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter): scroll animations
- ğŸ“¦Â [Zustand 4.0.0-rc.2](https://twitter.com/dai_shi/status/1548685973558800384?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter): ready for production
- ğŸ“¦Â [Redwood 2.1](https://github.com/redwoodjs/redwood/releases/tag/v2.1.0?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

segments.source_content: Hey! This is Tim from Storetasker. We run the best Shopify dev freelance network. I would love for you to apply if you enjoy building Shopify sites or are excited about leveraging Shopify'sÂ **cutting-edge React framework**Â for building custom storefronts:Â [**Hydrogen**](https://hydrogen.shopify.dev/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter).

translations.fr: Bonjour ! Je suis Tim de Storetasker. Nous gÃ©rons le meilleur rÃ©seau de dÃ©veloppeurs Shopify freelance. J'aimerais que vous postuliez si vous aimez crÃ©er des sites Shopify ou si vous Ãªtes enthousiasmÃ© par l'utilisation du **framework React de pointe** de Shopify pour crÃ©er des vitrines personnalisÃ©es : [**Hydrogen**](https://hydrogen.shopify.dev/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter).

segments.source_content: Accepted devs on the network work on a freelance basis, and we present them with great opportunities to work on some of the best Shopify brands (Alo Yoga, Chubbies, JUDY & many many more).

segments.source_content: The great thing about Storetasker is that devs aren't in competition with each other - they just pick up the jobs that match their interests. Beyond that - it's a very tight-knit community.

segments.source_content: [**Hermes as the Default**](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2022/07/08/hermes-as-the-default?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

translations.fr: [**Hermes par dÃ©faut**](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2022/07/08/hermes-as-the-default?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)
translations.en: [**Hermes as the Default**](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2022/07/08/hermes-as-the-default?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

segments.source_content: The JS Hermes engine is an alternative to JSC/V8. It can help your app to start faster via a pre-compilation in bytecode. With React-Native 0.70 (now inÂ [release candidate](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/releases/tag/v0.70.0-rc.0?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)), Hermes is enabled by default. Michael shares various benchmarks from the open-source app Mattermost. The Hermes distribution mode has changed to avoid ABI incompatibility issues. Missing Intl APIs have been added on iOS. Upcoming support for BigInt and WeakRef.

translations.fr: Le moteur JS Hermes est une alternative Ã  JSC/V8. Il peut aider votre application Ã  dÃ©marrer plus rapidement via une prÃ©-compilation en bytecode. Avec React-Native 0.70 (dÃ©sormais en [version candidate](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/releases/tag/v0.70.0-rc.0?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)), Hermes est activÃ© par dÃ©faut. Michael partage divers benchmarks de l'application open-source Mattermost. Le mode de distribution d'Hermes a Ã©tÃ© modifiÃ© pour Ã©viter les problÃ¨mes d'incompatibilitÃ© ABI. Les API Intl manquantes ont Ã©tÃ© ajoutÃ©es sur iOS. La prise en charge de BigInt et WeakRef est Ã  venir.
translations.en: Le moteur JavaScript Hermes est une alternative Ã  JSC/V8. Il peut aider votre application Ã  dÃ©marrer plus rapidement via une prÃ©-compilation en bytecode. Avec React-Native 0.70 (maintenant en [version candidate](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/releases/tag/v0.70.0-rc.0?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)), Hermes est activÃ© par dÃ©faut. Michael partage divers benchmarks de l'application open-source Mattermost. Le mode de distribution d'Hermes a Ã©tÃ© modifiÃ© pour Ã©viter les problÃ¨mes d'incompatibilitÃ© ABI. Les API Intl manquantes ont Ã©tÃ© ajoutÃ©es sur iOS. Support Ã  venir pour BigInt et WeakRef.

segments.source_content: [**What working at Airbnb during its React Native era taught me about web3**](https://medium.com/@devinabbott/what-working-at-airbnb-during-its-react-native-era-taught-me-about-web3-6d34d855d892?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

translations.fr: [**Ce que mon travail chez Airbnb pendant l'Ã¨re React Native m'a appris sur le web3**](https://medium.com/@devinabbott/what-working-at-airbnb-during-its-react-native-era-taught-me-about-web3-6d34d855d892?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)
translations.en: [**Ce que mon expÃ©rience chez Airbnb pendant l'Ã¨re React Native m'a appris sur le web3**](https://medium.com/@devinabbott/what-working-at-airbnb-during-its-react-native-era-taught-me-about-web3-6d34d855d892?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

segments.source_content: Devin goes over the history of React-Native at Airbnb and the very nuanced decision to sunset it He makes the interesting parallel with web3. In the long term, technology potential wins over the pain of early adopters.

translations.fr: Devin retrace l'histoire de React-Native chez Airbnb et la dÃ©cision nuancÃ©e de son abandon. Il Ã©tablit un parallÃ¨le intÃ©ressant avec le web3. Ã€ long terme, le potentiel technologique l'emporte sur les difficultÃ©s des early adopters.

segments.source_content: [**Vite 3**](https://vitejs.dev/blog/announcing-vite3.html?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

translations.fr: [**Vite 3**](https://vitejs.dev/blog/announcing-vite3.html?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)
translations.en: [**Vite 3**](https://vitejs.dev/blog/announcing-vite3.html?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

segments.source_content: Vite quickly became a reference in the frontend ecosystem. Today, it is a very good alternative to Create-React-App, with a much faster DX, and some React meta-frameworks are also using it (Storybook, Hydrogen...). v3 comes with a lot of changes, a new doc, starters for various frameworks (including React), improvements on global imports, a new doc... See also theÂ [ViteConf](https://viteconf.org/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)Â conference in October.

translations.fr: Vite est rapidement devenu une rÃ©fÃ©rence dans l'Ã©cosystÃ¨me frontend. Aujourd'hui, c'est une excellente alternative Ã  Create-React-App, avec une DX bien plus rapide, et certains mÃ©ta-frameworks React l'utilisent Ã©galement (Storybook, Hydrogen...). La v3 apporte de nombreux changements : une nouvelle documentation, des starters pour divers frameworks (dont React), des amÃ©liorations sur les imports globaux... Voir aussi la confÃ©rence [ViteConf](https://viteconf.org/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter) en octobre.
translations.en: Vite est rapidement devenu une rÃ©fÃ©rence dans l'Ã©cosystÃ¨me frontend. Aujourd'hui, c'est une trÃ¨s bonne alternative Ã  Create-React-App, avec une expÃ©rience dÃ©veloppeur bien plus rapide, et certains mÃ©ta-frameworks React l'utilisent Ã©galement (Storybook, Hydrogen...). La v3 apporte de nombreux changements, une nouvelle documentation, des starters pour divers frameworks (dont React), des amÃ©liorations sur les imports globaux, une nouvelle documentation... Voir aussi la confÃ©rence [ViteConf](https://viteconf.org/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter) en octobre.
